title: GMBL-turn devs into blockchain devs
description: There are not enough Cardano blockchain developers to deliver on the tidal wave of work coming our way.

f6_assessments.q0: This is a proposal to pay for 2 full time dev's for 4 months to improve the Gilballabs playground into the Alonzo era which has been built on a volunteer basis so far.
f6_assessments.q1: The proposers have already built up a working environment. This is a simple plan to pay for 2x4 months dev time to expand it into the Alonzo era of smart contracts. Every expectation they would be able to deliver, and these are the sort of proposers who the community should be supporting.
f6_assessments.q2: The deliverables are a little vague, just being upgrades to Gimbal Labs playground for the Alonzo era. This make progress a little hard to audit. Saying that, what is there so far has been delivered free, and there is no reason to doubt some great things will be built. Some general success metrics have been defined, it would be nice to see some goals attached to them.

f6_assessments.q0: Having proposed and lead many IT Projects I understand the need to find and train quality individuals that not only understand the technology but also are excited about what they are doing. I believe your efforts on creating expertise and developing process and documentation addresses this challenge. I 'Strongly Agree'
f6_assessments.q1:
I believe you have all the right components and process in place and have considered your risk and have focus on what you are wanting to accomplish.  

I'm not sure why you did not ask for a yearly budget for your developers.  I've worked as a consultant before and short term gigs always have you looking for better opportunities.  Maybe for the next fund request a yearly budget or some type of ADA payment to keep your personnel from looking.  

I feel you will be successful for this project duration so I'm 'Strongly Agree'
f6_assessments.q2: Given the plan you have laid out and your track record for openness of your activities. I 'Strongly Agree' you have provided a sufficient audit path.

f6_assessments.q0:
The proposal addresses the challenge effectively by providing detailed explanation of how it will help developer eco system. Primarily by onboarding of new experienced developers to blockchain development, the process has already given good amount of help for mainstream developers, such as cardanosharp for c# developers.

 IN addition,  Tools and documentation that Gimbalabs will build or are building allows an easier onboarding for developers into cardano eco system. As a developer myself i know that coding on blockchain in general differs from mainstream development, especially with cardano eco system, if you do not come from functional programming paradigm. These tools will help speeden up the onboarding process for new developers and cardano developer eco system will rapidly grow.
f6_assessments.q1: The experience of Gimbalabs in providing training, tools for developer eco system on cardano is well known by now. The experience is clearly reflected by the work that they have done and can easily be verified by the community by going to the progress from previous funding rounds and on their website. In addition, the plan that proposer proposes in this proposal is well outlined and presented to the community. Therefore, i strongly agree that this plan presented is highly likely to be implemented successfully.
f6_assessments.q2: INformation provided here is sufficient to audit the progress and success of this proposal,  However, it would be nice to provide these two developers to represent to the community, because imo as developer myself the budget is quite high :) are these developers gonna get the whole budget or gimbalabs keep some part of the funding to itself ? Such things should be made transparent to the community because this can directly impact the developers motivation imo. Also it would be great to expose these developers to community, as in typical client project scenarios (as client is the cardano community in this case), the developers must have the ability to represent themselves to the community.

f6_assessments.q0: The onboarding of developers is a critical requirement for Cardano. Plutus and Haskell offer a steep learning curve for imperative programmers. Functional programming has a fundamentally different approach. To bootstrap the process and the get more developers comfortable with the Cardano software development ecosystem. There is a need for continuous Handholding. A small Plutus Project-Based Learning team that can create a useful program and learn simultaneously is a very good and a unique effort. This core group can act as a catalyst for precipitating confidence in the developer community.
f6_assessments.q1: Gimbalabs Playground Sessions on youtube and Dandelion APIs of Gimbalabs have contributed to the growth of Cardano so far and have provided many aspiring developers functional support. with this background, it can be ascertained that the project will be implemented in the right earnest.
f6_assessments.q2: The project is divided into three phases. In Phase 1, the team has to train themselves. In phase 2, they will start developing apps and helps onboard people. And in the final phase, they have to onboard the required number of people. The deliverable is not defined clearly. However, it is likely to be uncertain in any such program with such a high component of training part. The outputs and process are in the open domain and can be clearly audited, including the methodology being followed for the training.

f6_assessments.q0: Gimbalabs has a long track of valuable contribution to Catalyst and Cardano. This proposal addresses the challenge as they will increase the number of Cardano blockchain developers. In addition, the will create tool and documentation to improve the onboarding process for new developers. As it is an urgent issue and critical for the success of Cardano to have skilled developers this proposal positively influence the development of Cardano.
f6_assessments.q1: As already stated, this team has a proven record of valuable contribution to Catalyst. From my own experience I have seen them executing several funded projects in addition to many volunteer work. All team members have a lot experience in the Cardano ecosystem. The provided plan is simple and easy to execute (as they are already doing the proposed work). The budget is clear, and its purpose is to pay 2 devs a full-time salary. I am convinced that this team will use the funds responsible and that this proposal will be successfully executed.
f6_assessments.q2:
In terms of the projected outcome of the proposal, they could add further details about success after a certain time can look like, e.g. how many developers they have onboarded.
Overall, Gimbalabs is operating very transparent and share their activities on Discord and Gitlab in very details. Therefore, we as the community have a lot of ways to track the progress of the project. Even without funding, they are doing this work.

solution: Support experienced developers to become experts in Cardano blockchain development.
experience: Proven track record of onboarding new devs to the Cardano ecosystem by providing essential tools and opportunities to collaborate.
